summary: A Year in the Life [6/12]
title: A Year in the Life [6/12]
body:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 6 - June

Word Count: 3.3k (14.8k total)

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: explicit smut

Read on AO3 | January | February | March | April | May

6/6/12 – 5:48 PM

For late spring, the evening weather was a bit too crisp for Dan’s liking. Though, if nothing else, it gave him an excuse to cocoon into his hoodie as he walked through Manchester. Catching his reflection in a shop window, he noticed the bright green of the fabric and swore under his breath, wishing York University had gone with more subtle colors. He briefly considered slipping back into the flat to change, but he was already ten minutes from home and decided it wasn’t worth the extra trip. For someone that had built a brand on never going outside, he had found himself taking solace in these walks through the city he called home, music blaring in his ears and allowing him to check out of reality.

Did his walks happen to coincide with Charlotte’s visits to their home? Maybe, but that was hardly worth addressing. If anything, Phil should be grateful he was being such a good friend and giving him space in such times. He’s been keeping to himself and staying out of the way, anyone should be so lucky to have such a scarcely-present housemate.

Then why the fuck was he calling him right now?

Dan rolled his eyes, pulling his phone out from his pocket. “What’s up?” it had better be something urgent, he thought. It was hard to clear his head when the source of the clutter kept reestablishing its presence.

“Hey, uh, we’re ordering Indian takeaway. Do you want anything?”

Oh, Phil had to be kidding him, Dan thought. He pinched the bridge of his nose and let out a breath. “Sure, just…just get my usual, okay? Thanks,” he answered, hanging up after exchanging goodbyes. He stared up at the sky for a moment, then turned on his heel to trek back to the flat. No point in letting his food just sit there.

But when Dan was sitting and eating dinner with Phil and Charlotte, he found himself wishing he had declined Phil’s offer. It wasn’t that they were being affectionate or handsy, it was that it felt awkward. There was a thick tension in the room that no amount of casual conversation or bad jokes could get rid of.

“You guys are headed to the states soon? Should be fun,” Charlotte broke another bout of silence as she picked at her meal.

“Yeah, first Vegas then Los Angeles, we’re looking forward to it,” Phil confirmed. “Gonna be a wild time celebrating Dan’s birthday in Sin City,” he added with a grin.

Dan’s brow quirked – that wasn’t the sort of thing you announce in front of your girlfriend, even if you weren’t especially exclusive. “I mean, we’ve never been to Vegas before. It’ll be cool to take in the sights and all that,” although he was talking to Charlotte, his gaze was on Phil, an incredulous expression – because what exactly was he trying to imply to her?

Phil may put on a naïve, innocent personality in front of the camera – keep everything PG, act oblivious to innuendos, but that was his AmazingPhil persona. Phil Lester is a twenty-five-year-old adult man, who makes dirty jokes, drinks alcohol, and has sex. Dan was certain he knew how he came across, he just didn’t quite understand why.

6/20/12 – 2:18 PM

Visiting Charlotte’s flat often felt like visiting a relative – Phil was never quite sure how comfortable he should allow himself to get, no matter how warm and inviting it was. He wouldn’t take his shoes off until instructed to, he didn’t touch much of anything, he even used the guest towels when in the bathroom. No matter how often he frequented her home – admittedly less often than the other way around – he didn’t feel at ease.

He supposed that made the ‘we need to talk’ text that landed him here inevitable.

Sitting and waiting for the conversation to transpire made Phil feel like a child waiting to be scolded. It didn’t take a master of perception to know where this was headed, and all he could do was brace himself for it. He chewed on his lip and fidgeted with his fingers, looking at the floor until Charlotte sat down beside him.

“Does Dan know that you’re in love with him?”

Phil sat upright and blinked. He knew Charlotte to be blunt, but that was far from the breakup line that he was anticipating. He wanted to be indignant – how dare she make such an accusation? His voice, however, completely escaped him when he opened his mouth to speak, his mouth ran dry and his tongue was taking up too much room.

“Do you know that you’re in love with him?”

His heart was pounding, and his stomach was knotting up. Sweat was beading up on his forehead and his cheeks flushed pink. “It’s more complicated than that,” he finally told her. And it was truly the best answer he could muster. He spent so long eradicating the word ‘love’ from his vocabulary, hearing it now felt foreign. It was too strong, too concrete. “Our whole relationship is more complicated than that.”

“Look, I get complicated. Life is complicated,” Charlotte’s tone was calm, far from the anger he had been preparing for. “But I’m not here to play the role of a distraction while you sort yourself out. I deserve someone that can give me one hundred percent of their heart, not one little room in the back of it,” she paused for a moment. “And you deserve to be happy, too. You’re undoubtedly the nicest, most caring guy I’ve ever dated. But god, you stopped in the middle of sex to answer a phone call from him. It’s pretty clear where your priorities are.”

She wasn’t wrong, they both knew that. Phil felt guilty, there was no good excuse for stringing her along like that. He sighed, letting his eyes drift downward. “So, you’re saying—”

“That I’m breaking up with you, yes.”

Phil nodded and got up, deciding there was nothing else to say. He wasn’t mad at her, but he was frustrated, perhaps more with himself than anyone else. “I better go,” he mumbled, leaving her flat with his tail between his legs. He didn’t even hear whatever Dan had called out to him upon his return, he just wanted to finish packing in peace. Vegas couldn’t come soon enough.

6/23/12 – 8:12 PM

Vegas was truly a captivating place. The lights, the sounds, the dubiously ethical activities – there was so much for them to take in, they hardly knew where to begin. The first couple days had gone well, sightseeing had proven to be a welcome distraction, and the joint liveshow had – they hoped – temporarily quelled the viewers’ need for content. That left them with the rest of their trip free, though they planned to film as much as they could.

Presently, they were in one of the several restaurant-casino combos on the strip, enjoying the overindulgence that was American cuisine.

“I just want to pack this up and bring it back home, eat it and relive how good this is,” Dan remarked with his mouth full.

Phil nodded in agreement, but it didn’t quite absolve him of his ‘off’ behavior. A few cocktails had gotten him close to a better mood, but he had been stewing in his thoughts since his breakup. He knew Dan knew as well, and his best friend’s lack of attempts to talk to him about it was not helping.

“Something still bugging you?” Dan had been operating under the idea that Phil would want to recover from the incident with Charlotte without him. His interference would only make things worse, he thought – which had been a contrast from his usual propensity to push himself into other people’s problems to ignore his own.

After finishing his drink and signaling for another, Phil answered. “I’m bouncing back from getting dumped, Dan,” he blinked and shook his head – the drinks had been so sweet and fruity, it was easy for him to forget how much alcohol was in there.

Dan frowned. “I thought you didn’t even like her that much. You wouldn’t have kept cancelling dates if you really fancied her,” he pointed out.

“That doesn’t make it feel any better!” he huffed, the outburst stunning both of them into silence, which carried through the rest of the meal.

“I’m gonna try my hand at the slots,” Phil announced, taking what was either his fourth or fifth drink with him, while Dan meandered over to the bar.

Even without being next to each other, tension continued to build. Trying to squash their feelings with alcoholic drink after drink only did so much. The music was blaring, and the lights were bright, all their senses were in a constant state of over-stimulation, most certainly making things worse. But they only existed apart for a couple hours, stumbling to the façade of the building to wait for a cab back to the hotel.

“Did you win?”

“I never fucking win.”

Dan rolled his eyes and let out a dry laugh. “Wow, testy today, aren’t we?”

“Oh, shut up!” Phil’s voice took on a rare, harsh tone, one he almost never had while sober. He got out after the cab came to a stop, and they both made their way out and into the hotel. “What the hell is your problem?” he asked, trying to keep up with his brisk pace without falling, catching his breath when they made it to the elevator.

Phil glared at Dan, suddenly hating being stuck in close quarters with him – be it only for a moment, until they were let out on their floor. His blood was boiling, and he barely saw straight enough to let them into the room. “You want to know what my problem is? body_abstract:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 6 - June

Word Count: 3.3k (14.8k total)

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: explicit smut

Read on AO3 | January | February | March | April | May

6/6/12 – 5:48 PM

For late spring, the evening weather was a bit too crisp for Dan’s liking. Though, if nothing else, it gave him an excuse to cocoon into his hoodie as he walked through Manchester. Catching his reflection in a shop window, he noticed the bright green of the fabric and swore under his breath, wishing York University had gone with more subtle colors. He briefly considered slipping back into the flat to change, but he was already ten minutes from home and decided it wasn’t worth the extra trip. For someone that had built a brand on never going outside, he had found himself taking solace in these walks through the city he called home, music blaring in his ears and allowing him to check out of reality.

Did his walks happen to coincide with Charlotte’s visits to their home? Maybe, but that was hardly worth addressing. If anything, Phil should be grateful he was being such a good friend and giving him space in such times. He’s been keeping to himself and staying out of the way, anyone should be so lucky to have such a scarcely-present housemate.

Then why the fuck was he calling him right now?

Dan rolled his eyes, pulling his phone out from his pocket. “What’s up?” it had better be something urgent, he thought. It was hard to clear his head when the source of the clutter kept reestablishing its presence.

“Hey, uh, we’re ordering Indian takeaway. Do you want anything?”

Oh, Phil had to be kidding him, Dan thought. He pinched the bridge of his nose and let out a breath. “Sure, just…just get my usual, okay? Thanks,” he answered, hanging up after exchanging goodbyes. He stared up at the sky for a moment, then turned on his heel to trek back to the flat. No point in letting his food just sit there.

“Yes, actually,” Phil rolled his eyes. “We had sex, Dan. We had sex a week before the biggest YouTube event of the year. And I think it’s because we’ve been building up to it, it was inevitable.”

Dan let out an exasperated sigh. “But what does it matter? We got drunk and hooked up, we had good sex when we were together, so we wanted some more without our inhibitions,” he wasn’t sure what he was trying to defend himself from, but he felt on edge, put on the spot. At the same time, he felt weak, like admitting that he wanted what had happened meant he couldn’t keep to his resolve of maintaining a platonic relationship with Phil.

“It matters because we still have feelings for each other, and it’s not fair to keep denying it,” it was difficult for Phil to not take Dan’s distancing from him as a personal rejection, no matter how many times they told themselves it was for the best.

“So, maybe we do,” he sighed, catching Phil off guard. “Maybe we never stopped having feelings for each other and you wasted a barista’s time for months. But what are we supposed to do? Let ourselves be branded as ‘Dan and Phil, YouTube couple’? The fans may be progressive but the people we’re looking to sponsor and employ us don’t want that. They want the two guys with the emo hair that pal around in front of a camera.”

Phil nodded as he listened. He had to admit, this was the most rational Dan’s argument had sounded since he first started making it. If they wanted to make it in the mainstream media, it might not be such a bad idea to play it safe with how they presented themselves and presenting themselves as an openly queer couple was a risk that they couldn’t afford to take. “Fine, maybe we can’t let anyone know. But can we stop pretending behind closed doors? Can we stop trying to distract ourselves with hookups and dates and just be with each other?”

Dan was quiet, pressing his lips into a fine line. He swallowed thickly, turning to look out the window. “I don’t know.”
trail.content_abstract:
Title: A Year in the Life

Summary: Everyone writes off 2012 as the year of ‘No Homo Howell’, implying that Dan’s demeanor was linked to stress over his sexuality and relationship with Phil. But that’s only the tip of the iceberg - with an unsteady future, undiagnosed mental illness, and suddenly thrust into the public eye, 2012 was a tumultuous year, one that no one has yet to truly understand.

Chapter: 6 - June

Word Count: 3.3k (14.8k total)

Relationship: Dan Howell/Phil Lester

Rating: E

Chapter Warnings: explicit smut

Read on AO3 | January | February | March | April | May

6/6/12 – 5:48 PM

For late spring, the evening weather was a bit too crisp for Dan’s liking. Though, if nothing else, it gave him an excuse to cocoon into his hoodie as he walked through Manchester. Catching his reflection in a shop window, he noticed the bright green of the fabric and swore under his breath, wishing York University had gone with more subtle colors. He briefly considered slipping back into the flat to change, but he was already ten minutes from home and decided it wasn’t worth the extra trip. For someone that had built a brand on never going outside, he had found himself taking solace in these walks through the city he called home, music blaring in his ears and allowing him to check out of reality.

Did his walks happen to coincide with Charlotte’s visits to their home? Maybe, but that was hardly worth addressing. If anything, Phil should be grateful he was being such a good friend and giving him space in such times. He’s been keeping to himself and staying out of the way, anyone should be so lucky to have such a scarcely-present housemate.

Then why the fuck was he calling him right now?

Dan rolled his eyes, pulling his phone out from his pocket. “What’s up?” it had better be something urgent, he thought. It was hard to clear his head when the source of the clutter kept reestablishing its presence.

“Hey, uh, we’re ordering Indian takeaway. Do you want anything?”

Oh, Phil had to be kidding him, Dan thought. He pinched the bridge of his nose and let out a breath. “Sure, just…just get my usual, okay? Thanks,” he answered, hanging up after exchanging goodbyes. He stared up at the sky for a moment, then turned on his heel to trek back to the flat. No point in letting his food just sit there.

summary: so a thing i havent seen anyone talk about is when they were reading the questions and at one point, both of them started...
body: so a thing i havent seen anyone talk about is when they were reading the questions and at one point, both of them started reading the question at the same time so phil just said “go on dan” and he was quiet for a bit but then dan replied with “we’ll read it together” and it just warmed my heart for some reason because this just shows how good with compromising they are, and ik this is a small example but on a larger scale it shows how they’ll meet in the middle if they had diff views/opinions or whatever and it doesn’t matter if it was a big deal or sth as small as this, they’ll just find a way around it and come to a middle ground. and i truly whole heartedly love that.

summary: this is a strange thing to ask, but in your opinion, what do dan and phil think about the whole ~phan~ phenomenon? do you think...
question: this is a strange thing to ask, but in your opinion, what do dan and phil think about the whole ~phan~ phenomenon? do you think they love it? do they find it funny? do they dislke it and wish people would get over it? i used to see a pretty obvious negative reaction from them, but these past two years i don't even know anymore. even after ii it's hard to tell what they think and what makes them uncomfortable because it was basically fanservice mixed with a bit of seriousness.
answer: Honestly? I wholeheartedly think phan started out as an amusing joke for two guys who were doing videos for shits and giggles and during the years it spiraled out of control - by the time they tried to stop it it was too late, as they somehow became international celebrities in the meantime, so in the end they decided to roll with it (”giving the people what they want" but still keeping their privacy). I could go on and on about this, if you want me to elaborate just ask

blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

summary: Fainting/Passing Out Masterlist
title: Fainting/Passing Out Masterlist
body:
Dizzy Future (ao3) - meggie_megs

Summary: “I’ll be back in a bit with the test results. Is there anything you need Mr. Lester?” the doctor asked Phil.

Based off Phil’s November 4th hospital visit.

Do It For Them (ao3) - Riddle

Summary: Dan passing out at a fan event shows the toll that fame and the pressure of never wanting to disappoint his fans has taken on him. Phil tries to help him get back to himself and help him get his priorities straight. But it becomes clear that there are more problems that originally thought even once Dan decides he wants to get better.

Don’t Faint on the Internet - forphansake

Summary: Phil faints in the middle of Dans liveshow, Dan forgets that he’s still on younow and says some things he didn’t mean to say in front of the Phandom.

I Hate This - awesomesockes

Summary: Dan and Phil have a panel on playlist live or vidcon and Dan collapses in front of everyone on stage and Phil catches him.

I’m Fine - awesomesockes

Summary: “Dan is sick but he doesn’t want Phil to know but then he faints on the radio show and Phil starts crying and long fluffiness.”

In The Heat Of The Summer - huphilpuffs

Summary: Dan’s blood pressure can’t handle the heat.

Jab Of Pain (ao3) - thesassykels66

Summary Dan and Phil get quick flu jabs for their tour, and Phil doesn’t have a good time.

Lean On - philsdrill

Summary: It’s halfway into the tour and Dan’s feeling a bit run down. When he doesn’t have the energy, Phil is a shoulder to lean on. Inspired by these photos from dapgo.

Make It Out When The Sun Is Ruined (ao3) - waveydnp

Summary: Phil fainted. he’s fine, but Dan might not be.

Shaking, Crying Planes in Storms - philsdrill

Summary: Dan is extremely claustrophobic and suffers a bad panic attack on the plane home from vidcon, but Phil is by his side, there to help. A surprise awaits them at the airport, and again, Phil has to help Dan. However, once they’re home, a video on his anxiety puts everyone at ease.

Soft Place to Land (ao3) - pasteldnp

Summary: Phil faints after several days of feeling poorly. He and Dan were sure it wasn’t anything serious after being assured Phil’s brain was fine, but then the doctors have more news for him.

Stay Hydrated - philsdrill

Summary: At a YouTube convention, Dan gets up too fast in excitement to see his American friends. What seems to be a combination of dehydration and his orthostatic hypotension causes him to pass out.

Take Care (ao3) - watergator

Summary: Dan and Phil return from the hospital.

The Neighbors Upstairs (ao3) - Riddle

Summary: Through videos and live chats Dan and Phil have told the story of their eclectic and sexually active downstairs neighbor, but this story looks at the lives of Dan and Phil–all of the ups and downs in their lives, going through the major events since they moved to London–through the eyes of their own downstairs neighbor who doesn’t quite understand what these two boys do with all of that filming equipment upstairs for money…

Underneath the Bandages - philsdrill

Summary: Dan hits his head whilst masturbating, and despite being rather awkward, the incident brings him closer with his best friend, Phil.

We’ll Make It Through This Together - interrupted-by-fireworks

Summary: Dan finds Phil passed out on the bathroom floor.

You Passed Out - philskoolkatz

Summary: Phil passes out during sex.

Jab Of Pain (ao3) - thesassykels66

Summary Dan and Phil get quick flu jabs for their tour, and Phil doesn’t have a good time.

Lean On - philsdrill

Summary: It’s halfway into the tour and Dan’s feeling a bit run down. When he doesn’t have the energy, Phil is a shoulder to lean on. Inspired by these photos from dapgo.

Make It Out When The Sun Is Ruined (ao3) - waveydnp

Summary: Phil fainted. he’s fine, but Dan might not be.

Shaking, Crying Planes in Storms - philsdrill

Summary: Dan is extremely claustrophobic and suffers a bad panic attack on the plane home from vidcon, but Phil is by his side, there to help. A surprise awaits them at the airport, and again, Phil has to help Dan. However, once they’re home, a video on his anxiety puts everyone at ease.

Soft Place to Land (ao3) - pasteldnp

Summary: Phil faints after several days of feeling poorly. He and Dan were sure it wasn’t anything serious after being assured Phil’s brain was fine, but then the doctors have more news for him.

Stay Hydrated - philsdrill

Summary: At a YouTube convention, Dan gets up too fast in excitement to see his American friends. What seems to be a combination of dehydration and his orthostatic hypotension causes him to pass out.

Take Care (ao3) - watergator

Summary: Dan and Phil return from the hospital.

The Neighbors Upstairs (ao3) - Riddle

Summary: Through videos and live chats Dan and Phil have told the story of their eclectic and sexually active downstairs neighbor, but this story looks at the lives of Dan and Phil–all of the ups and downs in their lives, going through the major events since they moved to London–through the eyes of their own downstairs neighbor who doesn’t quite understand what these two boys do with all of that filming equipment upstairs for money…

Underneath the Bandages - philsdrill

Summary: Dan hits his head whilst masturbating, and despite being rather awkward, the incident brings him closer with his best friend, Phil.

We’ll Make It Through This Together - interrupted-by-fireworks

Summary: Dan finds Phil passed out on the bathroom floor.

You Passed Out - philskoolkatz

Summary: Phil passes out during sex.
